Jesus invites us to assertiveness in the presence of God

helper.rol_van_god: God is the Object/Opponent to be moved, not the Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: The Spirit is the prize (Object), not the power for the praying.

a culture that can conjure a drug... to master everything
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The primary obstacle is God's 'weariness' and the human illusion of control. Sin/Death are mentioned but the functional opponent is the 'locked door' of the transaction.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical life of the church in the world (Acts) empowered by the Spirit.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The Spirit is received via the primary program (prayer) so that the secondary program (mission) can occur.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Jesus → Holy Spirit → The Persistent Petitioner

voorbeelden_god_subject: God will give the Holy Spirit
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We cannot, on our own, supply bread
we must receive bold wake-up calls

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on 'Willing' (Persistence/Impudence) as the key to unlocking 'Power' (Spirit). It assumes the hearer has the Devoir (must pray) and needs the Vouloir (boldness).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From Niet-S1 (Self-sufficiency) to S2 (God's snooze) to Niet-S2 (Impudence) to S1 (Generosity).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by human 'shamelessness' which forces the transition from God's reluctance to God's giving.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. God is depicted as genuinely inconvenienced, making the human effort necessary.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While it acknowledges human inability (Grace), the actantial structure makes human 'impudence' the trigger for divine action, creating a conditional 'deal'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Ask and it will be given, but only if we ask
make our need into God’s preoccupation

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The prayer acknowledges the limit of our capacity to save ourselves.
How much more will the heavenly father give the Holy Spirit

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: A contemporary child is used as the primary model for how the hearer should act toward God.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God is the one who persistently knocks on the door of the human heart (Rev 3:20).

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to be 'shameless' enough to get a response.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is contingent on the quality/intensity of the human petition.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is coherent in its 'transactional' logic but creates tension between 'God as Creator/Redeemer' and 'God as sleeping friend'.
spanning_punten: God as the source of help vs. God as the one who must be disturbed.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: defining engagement of our lives that disturbs God and evokes God’s generosity

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'force of life' given as a reward for persistence.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Moderate; sin is something we 'cannot forgive on our own' but is secondary to 'need'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon correctly identifies Man as the Receiver of the Spirit but incorrectly positions Man as the primary Subject/Initiator of the 'deal'.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: Man is the subject of 'asking, knocking, seeking' as a condition.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: God as the Subject who 'gives' before we ask, or who 'prompts' the prayer.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Because God is a Father who longs to give, He puts the cry of 'Abba' into our hearts.

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the child receiving the fish/egg.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on the 'How much more' as an ontological reality of God's character rather than a response to human impudence.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that the Spirit is already moving toward us.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Identify the 'Evil One' (mentioned in the text) as the true opponent.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is God's reluctance, prayer becomes a work to overcome God.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: God's Fatherhood → The Gift of the Spirit → Our Bold Response.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon powerfully captures the 'urgency' of faith but risks turning prayer into a new law of 'shamelessness'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the Aamira story is a 'hook'; actantially, it defines the hearer's role as a 'worker' for grace.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis notes the 'impudence' (anaideia); semiotics reveals that making this the 'Helper' actant shifts the sermon toward moralism.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that despite 'grace' language, the 'Axis of Desire' is powered by human 'persistence' rather than divine 'mission'.

appendices.notities: The sermon's title 'A Two-Sided Deal' explicitly signals a synergistic/transactional actantial structure.
